parameters: Hey, uhh, elf... girl? Sorry for being so noisy.
Yeah, just... make sure you be quiet. It's a library, duh.
My name is Ingrid, by the way. Not, uh, "Elf Girl."
Pretty name. That's my favorite season.
What, have you never seen an elf before?
N-no! Sorry, I just thought that your ears were cute!
I'm serious! This is gonna sound crazy, but this is my first time
actually going outside of my hometown! And there it was just like
ten humans in one mountain village way over...
Over somewhere, I'm actually not sure.
Must have had one wild journey if you can't remember where your
Oh, yeah. I'm trying to look for my Pops. He went missing one day
and told me not to look for him, but I went ahead anyway. What
does he mean, "don't come looking for me-"
Whoops. I'm gonna try not to raise my voice.
Hey, so you're an elf right? Does that mean you know magic?
Just because I'm an elf doesn't mean I know magic. Do you humans
know what an appendix does even though you have one?
\}That being said, I do know magic because I went to school for it.\{
Yeah, I did. Learned about "magic" and "spells" and "calculus."
So just, don't assume next time!
Anybody can learn magic, not just elves...
What do you want to know?
So you went to a magic school?
Where there like, wizard teachers and flying brooms and houses and
Hate to break it to you but my school was just pretty lame. I mean,
yeah all my teachers are wizards but really all you need to be a
wizard's just a lot of time studying and a piece of paper. Nothing
Flying brooms are total bunk, too. If you're going to put in the effort
to learn how to make a broom fly around and do tricks, you definitely
could've just learned how to use air magic and propel yourself without
As for potions... I just majored in Magical Engineering. There's
not really overlap with Potion Brewing. The way they teach it in
school's super boring anyway. Too much history and not enough
brewing. I learned all my potion stuff from my aunt.
Oh... well, are YOU a wizard...?
Oh man, yeah, can't wait to go back to school for another ten years
so I can become a wizard and go and do wizard shit for the next
fifty years of my life, woohoo.
Sorry, I meant to say I'm just a mage. Haven't done that yet.
So, what are elves like? I only know them from the stories my
Pops told me. All he really said was that you guys use a lot of magic.
As simple descriptions go, he's not wrong. We sure do use a lot of
Well, a lot of spiritually based magic. It's seen as a more superior
form to others but that's all just a bunch of old fart tradition speak,
Just means elves get to have this thing that they can hold over other
people's heads and say "See? Look at how great elves are! This magic
You should consider yourself lucky you're not over there where my
school was. Heavens, so many people up their own ass about using magic
or how "a strong mind leads to strong magic leads to a successful
This place here? It's nice. I think it's because people here actually do
work with their hands instead of with their mouths.
Want me to give you the long and short of it? I've got so much useless
knowledge up here it would probably give you a stroke if I tried to
bonk you over the head with it.
Ahhh, maybe just the important parts then.
PLAY THAT CHRONO TRIGGER SONG FROM YOUTUBE THAT GOT
RECOMMENDED TO YOU A LOT HERE
Magic primarily exists on a spectrum between spiritual and physical.
Elves tend to use spiritual magic, while dwarves gravitate towards
Y'see, dwarves get touchy if you call it "magic." It goes against their
own ideals of strength or whatever. I've heard they call it by some
other name, but I can't say I've met all too many dwarves, so sorry
Anyways, magic is really just the practice of being able to channel
ether and manifest it in specific ways. Ether is like this superphysical
substance that you can't sense without the use of magic, but it's
Someone using spiritual magic is more adept at using their head, and
their method of channeling ether is correlated with their ability
On the other hand, a physical user draws in ether through their
physical strength and it's basically the same as spiritual but
While there are a wide variety of easy to use "neutral" applications
of ether, like sensing or aggregation, the manifestation of magic
is really much deeper than that.
These specialized uses can vary from person to person, but there
you'll find things like shooting fireballs or flinging poison or
something like that. According to ancient magical scholars, these
powers reflect the soul of the magical wielder.
Oh, but I guess I got carried away. Did you, uhh, catch all
But that's so cool! I know you tried to make it sound all boring and
I kinda drifted off a couple times, but to me, it's all really awesome.
I'm surprised that you weren't interested in hearing more. I mean,
we didn't even touch on magical artifacts.
Yeah, sometimes in the natural world, inanimate objects react with
ether in really odd ways. Take teleportation stones for example.
They allow for instantaneous travel from one place to another. The
actual schematics of it are pretty freaky, but it's something like
generating a small wormhole blah blah blah.
...all of that just to take something from one place to another place.
Well, just so you know, while you two were chatting it up about rocks
or something stupid like that, I got our hands on a map!
So, Archer, find any good info talking to that intern?
Oh, darn, I forgot to ask!
Well, right now, we don't have much to go off of, but I all I know
is that his name was Augustus... if that helps?
He's really big and tall and he's got a beard and big bushy eyebrows.
Ugh, I've used my thinking muscles way too much today... I need
U-um, tell you what. Go ahead to the Mess Hall and get yourselves
something to eat. I'll try and think of where I've heard that name
You can get to the Mess Hall by going down the road and making a
right. It's a big building, you can't miss it.
You can get to the Mess Hall by going down the road and making a
right. It's a big building, you can't miss it.
Sorry, you just seemed terrified! I guess you already know about the
You look like you had a good time at the mess hall.
Well, that's only half of what's in here... There... might be some
Oh, so, I found one of those crystal things you were talking about-
You just... found a teleportation crystal?
Uh... yeah! I did! Check it out!
(It's a legitimate skip crystal. How did she find this?)
We used to use those to get around all the time.
So, after I got it, I got really hungry and tried to make a pie
appear since you said these things can, like, make something appear
You tried to SUMMON the pie?!
Yeah! Actually, the first one came out pretty good, but then the
second one smelled kinda funky, so I tried one last time, and then-
Wait, so you ACTUALLY managed to conjure items using the crystal?
Yep! All I had to do was think really hard about how much I wanted
(I underestimated her... But even still, it's hard to tell...)
Once I tried to summon a really big pie, though, it kinda sorta
came out with two legs and jumped away...
Ohhh, so THAT'S what I just saw break into the tower.
Yeah, the thing ran away before I could land a good hit in. Seems to
have sensed my intense aura and fled like a coward. I'm used to it by
You guys need to stop that thing, and fast.
There's a really big teleportation crystal at the top and if that
thing gets to it, I think some pretty bad things could end up
I'm just hypothesizing here, but if those things were made as a result
of improper teleportation... then who knows how many could spawn
from further contact with the crystal...
Yeah, sorry, hehe. I was just thinking about all that pie.
*Gulp* Huh... what a... strange thing to be excited for... Um, anyways,
you guys should focus on stopping that thing now.
You heard the elf, Autumn. Let's go.
I mean, us! Come with us! We could really use your help, 'cause neither
of us know anything about magic.
Hey, don't make it sound so bad!
Plus, you went to magic school, right? You've gotta know at least
a few battle spells! So come on!
Oh, I was trying to think of like, a nickname for you. Ingrey...Ingry...
Ingy... Whatever, it'll come to me eventually!
A mage... She'll make a fine addition.
But seriously, we need to get to that pie.
Here we are. The library. Just what we were looking for.
That's so many books... This is supposed to be a small one?
Believe me, the ones in Elven Green make this place look like a
Alright then, Archer. I'll go and search for a map, and you can
go and look for anything else that might seem helpful to us.
You guys in the back, could you PLEASE be quiet? I can hear you
Also you, Cape Guy. The maps are on that shelf to your right.
Oh, and Archer, see if you can find any good info.
I should probably \c[10]apologize to that elf lady first.\c[0]

Welcome to the Fort Hyde Library.
I'm busy right now, but if you need some help, you can consult my
assistant, Ingrid in the corner over there.
Just don't make too much noise.
What's the deal with that loud sound coming from out of nowhere?
Ever since Ingrid stepped down from her intern position, I've hired
I really don't mind that she quit. I could tell she didn't like it
Just don't tell her I said that.

I think I'm finall getting somewhere with this study business.
I asked Gertrud to hook me up with some performance-enhancing

She told me that was a horrible idea.
